description: From Middle English paxwax, a modification of faxwax (“nuchal ligament”), from fax (“head hair”) +‎ waxen (“to grow”). See wax (“to grow”), and compare faxed.

entries.meaning: (anatomy, obsolete) A strong ligament of the back of the neck in quadrupeds, connecting the back of the skull with dorsal spines of the cervical vertebrae; the nuchal ligament.
